greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest k>=1 such that n^2 + (n+1)^2 + ... + (n+k)^2 is prime or a(n)=0 if there is no such k.
comment: Every term is either 0 or 1 or 2 or 5.
a(n)=0 if and only if n is in A256385.
formula: 2) if 2n^2+2n+1 is not prime, but 3n^2+6n+5 is prime, then a(n)=2;
3) if 2n^2+2n+1 and 3n^2+6n+5 are both composite numbers, but 6n^2+30n+55 is prime, then a(n)=5;
results.author: _Vladimir Shevelev_, Mar 31 2015
ext: More terms from _Peter J. C. Moses_, Mar 31 2015
